summary: This document outlines the bylaws of Mort, Inc., detailing the structure and governance of the corporation, including the roles and responsibilities of shareholders and directors, meeting protocols, voting procedures, and indemnification of officers. It serves as a foundational legal document for the corporation's operations in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as a shareholder who adopted the bylaws of Mort, Inc.

keyFacts: The bylaws specify that the principal office of Mort, Inc. is located in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Annual meetings of shareholders are to be held on the second Tuesday in June each year.
The document outlines the procedures for calling special meetings of shareholders and the requirements for quorum.
It details the roles and responsibilities of the Board of Directors and the process for electing officers.
Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a shareholder who adopted these bylaws on April 12, 2011.
